docs.lead_paragraph: With green-tea flavoured toothpaste and pickled plum juice, an army of Chinese retailers is tapping local tastes to whittle away market share from global rivals that are banking their future growth on the world's second-largest consumer market.

headline.main: China Brands Beat Global Rivals With Tea Toothpaste & Pickled Plums
headline.print_headline: China Brands Beat Global Rivals With Tea Toothpaste & Pickled Plums

docs.snippet: With green-tea flavoured toothpaste and pickled plum juice, an army of Chinese retailers is tapping local tastes to whittle away market share from global rivals that are banking their future growth on the world's second-largest consumer market.

docs.abstract: Consuming probiotics has a small but significant effect in lowering blood pressure, a large review of studies has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: Market shelves are bare. Children are getting skinnier. Warnings of mass hunger have been made. The question now being considered is the big one: Is it a famine?

headline.main: Nursing Home Unthinkable? Be Prepared in Case It's Inevitable

headline.main: Drug Maker Hospira and France's Danone in Talks on $5 Billion Inversion Deal
headline.print_headline: Hospira and Danone in Talks on $5 Billion Inversion Deal

docs.abstract: If completed, the deal could be considered a “spinversion,” in which a foreign company spins off a unit to an American buyer that then reincorporates overseas.
docs.snippet: If completed, the deal could be considered a “spinversion,” in which a foreign company spins off a unit to an American buyer that then reincorporates overseas.

docs.lead_paragraph: French dairy group Danone is in talks to sell its medical nutrition business to U.S. group Hospira in a deal valuing the unit at about $5 billion, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

headline.main: Danone in Talks to Sell Medical Nutrition Unit to Hospira: FT
headline.print_headline: Danone in Talks to Sell Medical Nutrition Unit to Hospira: FT

docs.snippet: French dairy group Danone is in talks to sell its medical nutrition business to U.S. group Hospira in a deal valuing the unit at about $5 billion, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Volkswagen AG's premium brand Audi said it would cut spare-part prices in China as global automakers rush to change their pricing strategies after Chinese anti-monopoly regulators began probing the auto industry.

headline.main: Audi Cuts Spare-Part Prices in China Amid Anti-Monopoly Probe
headline.print_headline: Audi Cuts Spare-Part Prices in China Amid Anti-Monopoly Probe
